attributes.action: Impose a Tax on Companies that run Premium Rate Competitions, which are quasi lotteries
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Media companies often run highly lucrative competitions where viewers and listeners are enticed to try and win a prize.

Many of these are rigged, unfair contests.

Even those that are legal are a license to print money, because the price of entry to these competitions is usually a Premium rate phone or mobile tariff.

We argue that staking £1 a time to enter a competition makes this a lottery, and a form of gambling which should require a gambling license.

We think any company that has run such a competition should pay a gambling tax on its earning. (ten pence in the pound is the standard rate) 
 
This would address the unfairness of the Premium rate phone scams, and allow companies to make a fair tax contribution. The tax should be retrospectively applied.
